Articles.Content:
BSOD no matter what settings i try.

I never had a crash in .90

Could someone look at my output log and see if you can see anything.

OS: Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit

System Manufacturer Gigabyte Technology 

BIOS : Award modular BIOS v6.00PG

Processor: Intel® Core 2 DUO CPU E6750 @2.66GHz

(2 CPSs), 2.7GHz

Memory: 4096MB RAM

Page File :3210MB used, 4976MB available

DirectX Version: DirectX 11

NVIDIA GeForce GTS 450

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-29T23:26:12Z" title="05/29/2015 11:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 29, 2015</time> by GraviTykillz**

There is something very wrong with your save...

    [LOG 20:29:15.948] [PlanetariumCamera]: Focus: Untitled Space Craft[ERR 20:29:16.033] [Maneuver Solver Error]: No patch found for node at UT:141115.6[EXC 20:29:16.039] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.Parameter name: index	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[PatchRendering].get_Item (Int32 index)	OrbitTargeter.ReferencePatchSelect ()	OrbitTargeter.LateUpdate ()[EXC 20:29:16.044] NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object	PatchedConicRenderer.OnGUI ()[ERR 20:29:16.071] [Maneuver Solver Error]: No patch found for node at UT:141115.6

And just before the log ends you loaded that craft.

    [LOG 20:46:13.318] [FLIGHT GLOBALS]: Switching To Vessel Untitled Space Craft ---------------------- [LOG 20:46:13.319] setting new dominant body: KerbinFlightGlobals.mainBody: Kerbin[LOG 20:46:13.320] Reference Frame: Rotating[LOG 20:46:13.354] stage manager resuming...[LOG 20:46:13.355] Vessel assembly complete![LOG 20:46:13.356] stage manager starting...[LOG 20:46:13.357] all systems started[WRN 20:46:13.422] HighlightingSystem : Edge Highlighting requires AA to work![LOG 20:46:13.427] [ScenarioDestructibles]: Loading... 0 objects registered[LOG 20:46:13.431] Loading Depletion Nodes[LOG 20:46:13.432] DepNodeCount:  0[LOG 20:46:13.435] Loading Biome Nodes[LOG 20:46:13.436] BiomeNodeCount:  0[LOG 20:46:13.437] Loading Planet Nodes[LOG 20:46:13.438] PlanetNodeCount:  0[LOG 20:46:17.253] [PlanetariumCamera]: Focus: Untitled Space Craft[WRN 20:46:17.303] [CurrencyWidgetsApp]: No live widgets to Despawn![LOG 20:46:17.441] Flight State Captured[LOG 20:46:17.442] Saving Achievements Tree...[LOG 20:46:17.443] Saving Achievements Tree...[LOG 20:46:17.444] Saving Achievements Tree...[LOG 20:46:17.475] Game State Saved as persistent[LOG 20:46:18.480] [Untitled Space Craft]: ground contact! - error: -0.154m[LOG 20:46:18.482] Unpacking Untitled Space Craft[LOG 20:46:24.381] RCS lock/unlock[LOG 20:46:26.854] RCS lock/unlock[LOG 20:46:27.389] RCS lock/unlock[LOG 20:46:29.763] activating stage 0 - current stage: 1[LOG 20:46:29.764] [mk2Cockpit.Inline]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.765] [mk2SpacePlaneAdapter]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.767] [RAPIER]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.767] [deltaWing]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.768] [SmallGearBay]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.769] [StandardCtrlSrf]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.770] [StandardCtrlSrf]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.772] [deltaWing]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.773] [SmallGearBay]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.773] [StandardCtrlSrf]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.774] [StandardCtrlSrf]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.775] [mk2FuselageLongLFO]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.776] [mk2.1m.AdapterLong]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.777] [CircularIntake]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.778] [SmallGearBay]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.779] [wingShuttleDelta]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.780] [SmallGearBay]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.781] [wingShuttleDelta]: Activated[LOG 20:46:29.782] [SmallGearBay]: Activated[LOG 20:50:11.762] Maneuver Mode toggle

Then nothing, I suggest you don't load that craft, it may be best to edit it out of the save file.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-26T08:47:57Z" title="05/26/2015 08:47  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 26, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

Sal\_vager,

Thank you for your time, I want you to know I appreciate the time you have spent on these forums helping myself and others.

and the crashin..well it happens with any craft I build. I have completely reinstalled. and verified my cache in steam..and there is usually one or two files that need re-acquiring after every crash. I will completely delete and redownload again tonight. build a new craft and post when it crash(I sure it will)..
BSODs almost always point to hardware or driver errors. Given the symptoms, run a disk check and scan for bad sectors. If possible, check your windows system event logs and note any errors.

Adding to this, a BSOD will show an error code that should help figure out what caused the crash, [**this page has info on different stop errors**](http://pcsupport.about.com/od/findbyerrormessage/tp/stop_error_list.htm) (BSOD real name), you will need to find your Windows event log.

Thank you Sal. I will look and post the windows Stop errors.

Also when I crash.. after i validate program files thru steam..this time 3 files failed to validate and are will be reacquired..

I did clean install..here here is the last crash log

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/o4md37zs5jmw7gy/output_log%20%285%29.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/o4md37zs5jmw7gy/output_log%20%285%29.txt?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-26T23:42:45Z" title="05/26/2015 11:42  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 26, 2015</time> by GraviTykillz**
Nothing in the log this time GraviTykillz, the previous issue may be unrelated, I don't think we'll be able to determine any more without knowing that BSOD stop error.
It's that time of year when temperatures rise. I just cleaned all the dust out of my CPU and video card last week. 97% of stop errors I have personally experienced are from overheating video cards.

Your System looks very similar to my setup i had for like ages.. the 6750 is sort of.. problematic with Gigabyte Mobos (mine was crashing a damn lot, changing the mobo helped there). 

One thing to solve crashes on my setup was to enable(!) intelligent overclocking in the BIOS. As counterintuitive as it seems this helped me a lot. I was given the advise to do so as the gigabyte power saving features might have choked the cpu to death.. i was experiencing BSODs on high load scenarious in various games, but especially when doing cpu-heavy stuff (you may want to try SuperPI!). 

If possible you could try this.. it helped me to get only about 1/10 of the BSODs i had before.. then again i swapped mobos and the BSODs were gone.

Good luck!

Also, you can try running [Memtest86+](http://www.memtest.org/) or [Windows memory diagnostic tool](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Diagnosing-memory-problems-on-your-computer) to check memory, [Prime95](http://www.mersenne.org/) in stress test mode to test CPU, [VMT](http://sourceforge.net/projects/vmst/) to test Video memory, and [FurMark](http://www.ozone3d.net/benchmarks/fur/) to test GPU (and video memory). 

First, clean out any dust from heatsinks/fans.

I'd start with FurMark. If it BSODs or you see artifacting, your GPU is having problems. If that's stable, go to Prime95 stress tests. If you get errors, your CPU or memory is having issues. Run a memory test to determine which.

Thanks Again Sal\_vager!

SAI ! 

Running FurMark was the best thing i could have done!@ Showed me my problem, Which had nothing to do with KSP 

Thank you UnNerve for this advice.

> 
> It's that time of year when temperatures rise. I just cleaned all the dust out of my CPU and video card last week. 97% of stop errors I have personally experienced are from overheating video cards.

Been a couple of years since i have been in there and Damn..was rather dirty. A couple of cans of Air Later, and I've Played KSP for hours without crashing. It's Really the only game I play. So very Glad Im up in Outer Space( in my lil Kerbal world). Thank you to All who provided Help and Advice, proving once again what a great community KSP has.

Peace 

GKz
